text: Would Python make a good substitute for the Windows command-line/batch scripts?

I've got some experience with Bash, which I don't mind, but now that I'm doing a lot of Windows development I'm needing to do basic stuff/write basic scripts using 
the Windows command-line language.
For some reason said language really irritates me, so I was considering learning Python and using that instead.
Is Python suitable for such things?
Moving files around, creating scripts to do things like unzipping a backup and restoring a SQL database, etc.
